# bitmapInfo

**Instance Property**

The component information that describes the color channels.

## Declaration

```swift
var bitmapInfo: CGBitmapInfo
```

## Discussion

For example, ARGB8888 is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGImageAlphaInfo/first] `|` [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGBitmapInfo/byteOrderDefault], and BGRA8888 is [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGImageAlphaInfo/first] `|` [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/CoreGraphics/CGBitmapInfo/byteOrder32Little].

## Instance properties

- **bitsPerComponent**: The number of bits that represents one channel of data in one pixel.
- **bitsPerPixel**: The number of bits that represents one pixel.
- **colorSpace**: A description of the position of the pixel data in the image, relative to a reference XYZ color space.
- **version**: The version number.
- **decode**: The decode array for the image.
- **renderingIntent**: A rendering intent constant that specifies how Core Graphics handles colors that aren’t within the destination color space gamut.
- **componentCount**: The number of color and alpha channels.
